alert.note: Alert for Butler; Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Butler and west central Crenshaw Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 328 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms 8 miles northwest of Georgiana, or 12 miles southwest of Greenville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville and Georgiana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for south central Alabama.
